decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up to cast big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Endbringer, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass. The deck utilizes lands like Ancient Tomb, Cloudpost, and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate mana production and take advantage of powerful Eldrazi synergies. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly while controlling the board state.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker. It also utilizes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to help push through damage. The deck's mana denial strategy is further enhanced by cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while cards like Flickerwisp and Palace Jailer provide additional utility and removal options. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent through efficient creature and equipment interactions.

The deck is focused on using a combination of control spells and Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan while also generating card advantage. Key cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, True-Name Nemesis, and equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional threats and value. The deck aims to control the game and slowly grind out victories by out-valuing the opponent through efficient use of powerful cards and counterspells, while also having access to disruption in the form of Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this deck is to use the "Show and Tell" card to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn early in the game. This combo is supported by cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience, allowing you to quickly overwhelm your opponent with big threats. The deck also includes plenty of card draw and countermagic to help protect your combo and find the pieces you need to win. It is a high risk, high reward strategy that aims to win the game quickly before your opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Supported by mana acceleration with cards like Grim Monolith and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly ramp up to play bigger threats like Endbringer and Walking Ballista. Additionally, Chalice of the Void and Umezawa's Jitte provide disruption and further increase the deck's aggressive potential.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to slow down opponents while using Aether Vial to cheat out creatures quickly. It also utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to increase pressure. The deck also includes cards like Mother of Runes and Palace Jailer for protection and removal. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, this deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with a solid game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to play aggressively with low cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells to control the game. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly with cards like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, while also hindering their strategies with counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This Legacy deck focuses on using disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to control the opponent's game plan while utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to equip powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to apply pressure. The deck also has tools like Karakas and Flickerwisp to deal with opposing threats, and Mother of Runes to protect key creatures. With a mix of aggressive beatdown and disruptive elements, this Death & Taxes deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure to win the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, then bring them back onto the battlefield through various reanimation spells like Exhume and Reanimate. Cabal Therapy and Unmask provide disruption for the opponent's game plan, while cards like Faithless Looting and Dark Ritual help accelerate the combo. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early on and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of aggressive zombie creatures and sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Goblin Bombardment to continuously recur creatures from the graveyard and deal damage to the opponent. This strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with hasty creatures like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler, while also disrupting their hand with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. Lingering Souls provides additional blockers and value, while Faithless Looting helps dig through the deck for key combo pieces. Overall, the deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck utilizes a combination of land destruction and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while creating a powerful win condition with the Dark Depths combo. Cards like Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and Punishing Fire help to keep the opponent's resources in check, while Life from the Loam and Exploration provide powerful card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck aims to control the board and grind out incremental advantages until it can assemble the Dark Depths combo for a quick and decisive victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and powerful Planeswalkers. It utilizes cards like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Baleful Strix and Punishing Fire provide value and removal. Dack Fayden and Jace, the Mind Sculptor offer card advantage and manipulation, while cards like Kolaghan's Command and To the Slaughter provide flexibility in dealing with various threats. The deck's mana base allows for efficient casting of spells and ensures access to all the necessary colors.

This Merfolk aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Silvergill Adept, and Master of the Pearl Trident. Utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat creatures into play and protect them with Force of Will, the deck also disrupts opponents with Chalice of the Void and Cursecatcher. By maximizing tribal synergies with Lord of Atlantis and Harbinger of the Tides, the deck can establish a fast clock and maintain board control to secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up mana and card advantage through various cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Chrome Mox, while using cards like Burning Wish and Infernal Tutor to search for key combo pieces like Ad Nauseam and Empty the Warrens. The deck aims to generate a critical mass of spells in a single turn to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony with Storm count. The deck utilizes various hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand onto the battlefield early using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also utilizes cards like Omniscience and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to gain additional advantage and control the game. The deck runs cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm for consistency and interaction spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own powerful plays to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer to chip away at the opponent's life total. It also includes plenty of card draw and counterspells to control the game and protect your creatures. The mana base provides access to a variety of colors while also disrupting the opponent's mana with Wasteland. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game until you can close out the match with burn spells or evasive creatures.
